SENT.plain: A case of tuberculous brain infection following tuberculous meningitis in a 67-year-old man is presented
It was located in an old cerebral infarct associated with left internal carotid artery occlusion
CT demonstrated capsule enhancement in the left temporal area after iodinated contrast medium
Chemotherapy with INH, RFP and SM diminished the lesion and the capsule disappeared thirteen months later

It is suggested that a relatively long clinical history together with the appearance of a thick-walled abscess-like lesion on the CT scan is consistent with the diagnosis of tuberculous brain infection, perhaps an abscess
